arm_group.description: Delivery should be managed by using the perineal protection device when the head was crowning and 5-6 cm of it was visible. One part the "tongue" was inserted between the head and the posterior vaginal wall and the "two wings" were held against the perineum and kept in place by the delivery attendant's hand.
Standard care at delivery: Manual support of the perineum

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether a modified perineum protection device can
      reduce tearing during delivery.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of the Modified Perineal Protection Device During Delivery

detailed_description.textblock:
RCT investigation using a modified device during delivery of the baby's head (an earlier
      model has proved successful) and assess whether the use can decrease delivery tears as
      measured in length.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Vaginal delivery at term (week 36 - 41)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Age below 18

          -  Breech delivery

          -  Not understanding written and oral information

intervention.description: A device used to reduce perineal tears during delivery of the baby.
intervention.other_name: The perineal protection device have no brand name.

facility.name: Dept Obstetrics and Gynecology, Helsingborg Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT) of Primiparous Women Using the Modified Perineal Protection Device

overall_official.affiliation: Campus Helsingborg, Clinical Science Faculty of Medicine, Lund University, Helsingborg, Sweden

primary_outcome.description: The outcome measured is the occurrence of first and second degree vaginal and perineal tears during delivery.
primary_outcome.measure: Length of delivery tear measured in cm with ruler
primary_outcome.time_frame: at delivery - Participants will be followed for the duration of the first 24 hours

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Measure eventual adverse effects on mother and child.
secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse effects of the device on mother and child
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at delivery-Participants will be followed for the duration of the first 24 hours

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
